Let me begin by saying that I was NOT impressed.  The ambiance was superb but I cannot say that for the food.  My wife and I came here after going to a few other Tapas places in the area throughout the week because it was given great ratings.  The place was packed on a Saturday night which is to be expected in its prime location.  We started off with a pitcher of the sangria which was tasty.  There is a secret menu with special dishes.  We tried a couple Shrimp dishes and the prawns were down right disgusting.  They tasted almost rotten.  The fried calamari was ok, but I have had better calamari from a hole in the wall bar.  Overall I was very un happy with the waiter and staff personality and quality of food.  I would suggest trying out Tapas 24 or La Pepita which are nearby, far superior in my mind
